required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: CLamp vs Off Clamp Kidney During Partial Nephrectomy
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Randomized Trial Comparing Clamp Versus Clampless Robot Assisted Partial Nephrectomy

lead_sponsor.agency: Azienda Ospedaliera Spedali Civili di Brescia

clinical_study.source: Azienda Ospedaliera Spedali Civili di Brescia

brief_summary.textblock: Prospective, randomized trial comparing surgical, functional and oncological outcomes between clamp and clamp-less robot assisted partial nephrectomy.

primary_outcome.description: difference between pre and post operative Glomerular Filtration Rate (GFR)

secondary_outcome.measure: Feasibility of clampless robotic partial nephrectomy
secondary_outcome.description: number of cases shifted from clampless to clamping procedure; time of suture of the renal parenchyma; overall operative time.

secondary_outcome.measure: Morbidity of clampless robotic partial nephrectomy
secondary_outcome.description: Estimated blood loss; pre/post operative variation of hemoglobin value; overall complications rate; bleeding complications rate

secondary_outcome.measure: Oncological safety of clampless robotic partial nephrectomy

arm_group.description: Laparoscopic robot-assisted partial nephrectomy with clamping the renal pedicle during the resection of the tumor
Laparoscopic robot-assisted partial nephrectomy without clamping the renal pedicle during the resection of the tumor

intervention.description: Renal artery clamping during partial nephrectomy
Robotic partial nephrectomy without renal artery clamping

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- normal coagulation trim
- pre operative Glomerular Filtration Rate (GFR) > 60 ml/min
- healty contralateral kidney
- low (4-6) or intermediate (7-10) RENAL score
- availability of Da Vinci Robotic System
Exclusion Criteria:
- altered coagulation trim
- pre operative Glomerular Filtration Rate (GFR) < 60 ml/min
- anatomic or functional solitary kidney
- RENAL score >10

facility.name: Clinical Department of Urology, university Hospital Spedali Civili di Brescia
